name: Raksha Bandhan
title: Bond of Protection - Rakhi
description: Raksha Bandhan is a beautiful Hindu festival celebrating the sacred bond between brothers and sisters. On this day, sisters tie a protective thread (rakhi) on their brothers' wrists, and brothers promise to protect their sisters.
significance: Celebrates the eternal bond of love and protection between brothers and sisters, symbolizing the promise of safety and care.

seo.description: Complete guide to Raksha Bandhan festival with rituals, stories, rakhi designs, gifts, and celebrations. Learn the significance of the bond of protection.

sections.title: Welcome to Raksha Bandhan
sections.content: Raksha Bandhan celebrates the beautiful and sacred relationship between brothers and sisters. This festival strengthens family bonds and reiterates the promise of protection and love.

sections.title: Historical Significance
sections.content: Raksha Bandhan has ancient origins and is mentioned in various historical texts and mythological stories. The festival has been celebrated for centuries across India.

sections.title: Famous Stories
sections.content: Raksha Bandhan is associated with several inspiring stories from Indian history and mythology.

subsections.title: Draupadi and Krishna
subsections.content: When Krishna injured his finger, Draupadi immediately tore a piece of her sari and tied it around his finger. In return, Krishna promised to protect her always, fulfilling this promise during her disrobing in the Kaurava court.

subsections.title: Rani Karnavati and Humayun
subsections.content: When Rani Karnavati of Chittor was attacked by Bahadur Shah, she sent a rakhi to Mughal Emperor Humayun, seeking his protection. Humayun, respecting the sacred bond, came to her aid.

sections.title: How Raksha Bandhan is Celebrated
sections.content: Raksha Bandhan is celebrated with joy, gifts, and family gatherings.

subsections.title: Rakhi Tying Ceremony
subsections.content: Sisters prepare a thali with rakhi, kumkum, rice grains, diya, and sweets. They perform aarti, apply tilak on their brothers' foreheads, and tie the rakhi.

subsections.title: Gift Exchange
subsections.content: Brothers give gifts to their sisters as a token of love and appreciation. Traditional gifts include clothes, jewelry, money, and sweets.

sections.title: Rituals and Traditions
sections.content: Raksha Bandhan rituals are simple yet meaningful.

subsections.title: Preparation of Thali
subsections.content: Sisters prepare a decorative thali containing rakhi, roli, akshat (rice grains), diya, and sweets for the ceremony.

subsections.title: Tilak and Aarti
subsections.content: Sisters apply tilak on their brothers' foreheads, perform aarti, and chant prayers for their well-being and prosperity.

sections.title: Raksha Bandhan Special Foods
sections.content: Traditional sweets and dishes prepared for Raksha Bandhan.

subsections.title: Traditional Sweets
subsections.content: Popular sweets include Ladoo, Barfi, Jalebi, and Kheer. These are prepared at home and shared with family.

subsections.title: Festival Meals
subsections.content: Special meals are prepared with favorite dishes of both brothers and sisters, celebrating family togetherness.

sections.title: Raksha Bandhan Bhajans
sections.content: Devotional songs celebrating the brother-sister bond.

subsections.title: Bhaiya Mere Rakhi Ke Bandhan
subsections.english:
Brother, to fulfill this bond of rakhi
You will have to come
This bond of eternal love
Should never be broken
subsections.meaning: This beautiful song expresses the emotional bond between brother and sister.

sections.title: Raksha Bandhan Aartis
sections.content: Traditional aartis performed during Raksha Bandhan.

subsections.title: Rakhi Aarti
subsections.english:
Sister brings offerings for rakhi
Send prayers for brother
May my brother live long
May my brother always be happy
subsections.meaning: This aarti expresses the sister's heartfelt prayers for her brother's well-being.
